rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;994d76ef.1502">   <title>Announcement Decolonizing The Mind Summer School Amsterdam July 19-31 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;994d76ef.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>The International Institute for Scientific Research has started a new and exciting project: the Decolonizing The Mind Summer School. The first edition is 2015 in Amsterdam.<br><br>The following information is available about the Summer School:<br><br>The most important information is the brochure with the detailed description of the Summer School: http://www.decolonizingthemind.org/download/DTMSM2015Brochure.pdf. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-15T16:15:16+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sandew Hira</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;994d76ef.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;68b3d76f.1502">   <title>Announcing the 50th Title from MuseumsEtc: Photography and Urban History </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;68b3d76f.1502</link>   <description> STREET LIFE IN LONDON: John Thomson and Adolphe Smith's Masterpiece of<br>Photography and Urban History<br><br>&quot;The first concerted body of work to deal with life on the streets of a<br>major European or American city.&quot;<br><br>For our 50th title we're thrilled to be publishing a brand-new edition of<br>this innovative and hugely influential work - pioneering in its use of<br>ethnological recording, of documentary photography, and as &quot;one of the most<br>far-reaching photobooks in the medium's history&quot;. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T12:13:03-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Graeme Farnell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;68b3d76f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;5ce88e36.1502">   <title>Registration reminder: Being Modern </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;5ce88e36.1502</link>   <description> Intending participants of the &quot;Being Modern&quot; conference are reminded that 28 February is the deadline for registering at the early-bird rate. For the exciting programme and link to registration pages, please visit &lt;www.qmul.ac.uk/being-modern/&gt;<br><br>Remember Institute of Historical Research 22-24 April. The theme is an interdisciplinary approach to science and culture in the early twentieth century. Engagement with science was commonly used as an emblem of "Being modern", across culture in Britain and the western world in the years around the First World War. This conference will be held on the exact centenary of the first use of poison gas on [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-07T16:22:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Bud</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;5ce88e36.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;9f826e94.1412">   <title>CALL FOR AUTHORS: The SAGE Encyclopedia of Advertising & Society </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;9f826e94.1412</link>   <description> Greetings,<br><br>Golson Media is producing The SAGE Encyclopedia of Advertising &amp;<br>Society. We are reaching out to members HISTORY-IDEAS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>to join this exciting project.<br><br>We are inviting academic editorial contributors to The SAGE<br>Encyclopedia of Advertising &amp; Society, a new 4-volume reference to be<br>published in 2016. As corporations spend $620 billion globally each<br>year to make their products desirable, we are examining how<br>advertising affects society, not only in the United States but around<br>the world, from China\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds newfound, regulated capitalism to political<br>attack ads in the United Kingdom. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-11T15:32:41+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mark Golson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;9f826e94.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;3f6b5e09.1411">   <title>Midlands3Cities Application Writing Workshop </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;3f6b5e09.1411</link>   <description> With apologies for cross-posting<br><br>List members may be interested to hear of a PhD Funding Application Writing Workshop, hosted this Saturday by the University of Birmingham and Birmingham City University.<br><br>The event is an excellent opportunity for prospective PhD students to meet academics and peers, gain an insight into life as a funded PhD student, and receive tailored advice on their application. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-26T12:12:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Dale Bilson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;3f6b5e09.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;4968c372.1410">   <title>'Animal Instinct and Whispering Machines: Science in the Victorian Periodical' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;4968c372.1410</link>   <description> You are warmly invited to join us on *Tuesday 4th November*, when Prof<br>Sally Shuttleworth (Oxford) will be addressing our Seminar with her paper<br>entitled: 'Animal Instinct and Whispering Machines: Science in the<br>Victorian Periodical'.<br><br>*We begin at 5:30pm in Room G24, Foster Court, University College London,<br>Malet Place, London WC1.*<br><br>Please note the change of venue. Directions to this building can be found<br>here: http://www.ucl.ac.uk/maps [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-31T12:04:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Niall Sreenan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;4968c372.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;6465c145.1410">   <title>New Book from MuseumsEtc: Street Life in London - Context andCommentary </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;6465c145.1410</link>   <description> The first-ever analysis of &quot;One of the most significant photobooks in the<br>medium's history.&quot;<br><br>List members may be interested in this new book, which examines the 1877-78<br>publication Street Life in London, &quot;one of the most significant and<br>far-reaching photobooks in the medium's history&quot; (The Photobook: A<br>History). In its pages, journalist Adolphe Smith and photographer John<br>Thomson aimed to reveal, through the innovative use of photography and<br>essays, the conditions of a life of poverty in London. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-30T12:52:03-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Graeme Farnell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;6465c145.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;68e32ca7.1410">   <title>Transgressing Boundaries (repost) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;68e32ca7.1410</link>   <description> Please reply to: tuomas.tikan@GMAIL.COM<br><br>Dear Colleague,<br>I am happy to announce that my latest book, Transgressing Boundaries: Worldly Conversation, Politeness and Sociability in Ancien R\ufffd\ufffdgime France, 1660-1789, is now available on Amazon and Google Books for preview. The book offers a new interpretation of Ancien R\ufffd\ufffdgime sociability, which in the past two decades has been the object of extensive study within the field of cultural and intellectual history. My book deals with the art of polite conversation and conversational practices in salons and other fashionable gatherings of Ancien R\ufffd\ufffdgime high society. Whereas recent scholarship has concentrated on different forms of [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-15T11:56:28+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Clive Hill</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;68e32ca7.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;296161f1.1410">   <title>ISLAMIC ART AT LEIGHTON HOUSE MUSEUM </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;296161f1.1410</link>   <description> PLEASE REPLY TO: islamic@iesa.edu<br>STUDY DAYS: ISLAMIC ART AT LEIGHTON HOUSE MUSEUM! Collecting and Display of the Arts of the Islamic World from the medieval period to the contemporary art market Set in the surroundings of Leighton House, created at the end of the 19th century as an exotic and marvellous recreation of an Islamic palace, these series of lectures explore the inter-relationships between East and West from different perspectives. Intended for anyone with an interest in Islamic arts, the lectures present a new approach to the understanding, appreciation and communication of Islamic art and culture. By broadening the traditional [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-09T10:03:51+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Clive Hill</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;296161f1.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;d168f11e.1409">   <title>India and Europe in the global eighteenth century. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;d168f11e.1409</link>   <description> Oxford University Studies in the Enlightenment<br>Voltaire Foundation, University of Oxford<br>www.voltaire.ox.ac.uk<br><br>Dear Colleague,<br><br>Please forward to the early modern/eighteenth-century specialist within your department.<br><br>I am writing to let you know about a recent publication in our Oxford University Studies in the Enlightenment series:<br>&quot;India and Europe in the global eighteenth century&quot;<br>Edited by Simon Davies, Daniel Sanjiv Roberts and Gabriel Sanchez Espinosa<br>(http://xserve.volt.ox.ac.uk/VFcatalogue/details.php?recid=6564) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-23T15:50:23+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Voltaire Foundation</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;d168f11e.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;b1caeccd.1409">   <title>Call for papers Being Modern </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;b1caeccd.1409</link>   <description> Call for papers for a major conference<br><br>Being Modern: Science and Culture in the early 20th century<br><br>Institute of Historical Research, London 22-24 April 2015<br><br>Engagement with science was commonly used as an emblem of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBeing modern\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, across culture in Britain and the western world in the years around the First World War. Today, historical studies of literature, art, design, lifestyle and consumption as well as of the human sciences are exploring intensively, but frequently separately, on that talk of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdscience\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Historians of science are exploring the interpenetration of discourse in the public sphere and expert communities. This pioneering interdisciplinary [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-12T11:18:21+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Robert Bud</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;b1caeccd.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;67d020db.1408">   <title>The Virtues of Abandon: An Anti-Individualist History of the French Enlightenment </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;67d020db.1408</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting<br><br>[cid:image003.jpg@01CFC2AA.27714FC0]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/virtues-of-abandon&gt;The Virtues of Abandon&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/virtues-of-abandon&gt;<br>An Anti-Individualist History of the French Enlightenment<br>Charly Coleman<br><br>&quot;Charly Coleman's The Virtues of Abandon will transform the way we think about the Enlightenment and its relationship to the Revolution. Ranging across a very wide range of intellectual fields and forms of social practice, Coleman uncovers a religious, mystical strain of thinking which runs in fruitful counterpoint with the more familiar, secularising Enlightenment narratives.&quot;-Colin Jones, Queen Mary, University of London [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-08-28T09:23:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Shand</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;67d020db.1408</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;7e6266d.1406">   <title>Table of Contents: Sartre Studies International (Vol.20, No. 1) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;7e6266d.1406</link>   <description> Published in Association with the United Kingdom Sartre Society and North American Sartre Society<br><br>Dear Colleague,<br><br>We are pleased to announce that Volume 20, Issue 1 of Sartre Studies International has been published by Berghahn Journals. This issue explores a wide range in topics such as: a Sartrean perspective on cyber-dissidence, the concept of counter-finality and an examination of whether Sartre's final interviews,indicate a final turn to God and religious belief. The issue concludes with book review. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-17T20:24:45+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Young Lee</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;7e6266d.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;9c96080e.1405">   <title>Workshop: Memory and Emotion in Nineteenth-Century German Visual Culture </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;9c96080e.1405</link>   <description> If responding to this email, please address Colleen (colleen.becker@sas.ac.uk) or Eric (eanderso02@risd.edu)<br>and NOT Clivehill@hotmail.com OR history-ideas@jiscmail.ac.uk. Thank you.    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-19T12:37:10+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Clive Hill</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;9c96080e.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;42659259.1404">   <title>CALL FOR AUTHORS: The SAGE Encyclopedia of War: Social Science Perspectives </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;42659259.1404</link>   <description> Greetings,<br><br>The story of social science and war is a long one, going back to the Roman<br>military in the late second century B.C.E., when soldiers became the<br>empire's worst enemy, pillaging citizens and creating social turmoil. But<br>it is a story that has not been amply told. A long list of reference works<br>exists viewing war through the traditional lens of history and military<br>science, emphasizing the big events, places, and people in wars across the<br>ages. Setting itself apart, The SAGE Encyclopedia of War: Social Science<br>Perspectives will view war through a different lens\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdthat of the social<br>sciences. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-22T23:41:08-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mark Golson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HISTORY-IDEAS;42659259.1404</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
